items.title: Wordpress function within a shortcode only working once on the page
items.body:
I am currently using a shortcodes on the My Account page (WooCommerce + Wordpress) to check if a user owns that course before displaying the image and link to access the content. If I use just 1 shortcode it works beautifully. But as soon as I add a second shortcode with a different product idea it just outputs a white page.

//Displays course module image
//[checkpurchase course="" url="" img=""]
function checkpurchase_shortcode( $atts, $content = null ) {

    //set default attributes and values
    $values = shortcode_atts( array(
        'course'    => '0',
        'url'   => '#',
        'img'   => '#',
    ), $atts );     
    $content = "";

    $courseid = esc_attr($values['course']);

    //check if they purchased the course through WooCommerce
    function check_coursepurchase($courseid) {
        global $woocommerce;
        $user_id = get_current_user_id();
        $current_user= wp_get_current_user();
        $customer_email = $current_user->email;

        //if they own the product return true
        if ( wc_customer_bought_product( $customer_email, $user_id, $courseid)) {
                return true;
        } 
        return false;
    }

    //if they own the product them display access
    if( check_coursepurchase($courseid) ){
        //make icon on the my account page for the course
        return '<a href="'. esc_attr($values['url']) .'"  target="_blank"><img src="'. esc_attr($values['img']) .'" border="0" /></a>'; 
    }
}
add_shortcode( 'checkpurchase', 'checkpurchase_shortcode' );

items.body_markdown:
I've got a Web API that must communicate with a few different services. Currently, I have the Web API set to use the following security protocol:

`ServicePointManager.SecurityProtocol = SecurityProtocolType.Tls12;`

When the API calls out to another service via `HttpClient` (say like Twitter), it will use that protocol. At the same time however, another request may come in to access something from the cloud, which for whatever reason, currently requires TLS (not TLS 1.2). The request to the cloud, before firing out, sets the security protocol again:

`ServicePointManager.SecurityProtocol = SecurityProtocolType.Tls;`

The problem I'm running into is when two separate and unique requests come in, one for Twitter and one for the cloud, the security protocol could switch over to the "wrong one" before it's sent out, causing the request to fail. 

**Is there a way to set the security protocol on the `HttpClient` per request so that I'm not swapping around a setting in some singleton somewhere?**
items.title: Changing security protocol per request (HttpClient)
items.body:
I've got a Web API that must communicate with a few different services. Currently, I have the Web API set to use the following security protocol:

ServicePointManager.SecurityProtocol = SecurityProtocolType.Tls12;

When the API calls out to another service via HttpClient (say like Twitter), it will use that protocol. At the same time however, another request may come in to access something from the cloud, which for whatever reason, currently requires TLS (not TLS 1.2). The request to the cloud, before firing out, sets the security protocol again:

ServicePointManager.SecurityProtocol = SecurityProtocolType.Tls;

The problem I'm running into is when two separate and unique requests come in, one for Twitter and one for the cloud, the security protocol could switch over to the "wrong one" before it's sent out, causing the request to fail.

Is there a way to set the security protocol on the HttpClient per request so that I'm not swapping around a setting in some singleton somewhere?

    binPhysicsBody = SKSpriteNode(imageNamed: "binPhysicsBody")
    binPhysicsBody.name = "binPhysicsBody"
    binPhysicsBody.physicsBody = SKPhysicsBody(texture: binPhysicsBody.texture!, size: binPhysicsBody.texture!.size())
    binPhysicsBody.setScale(0.15)
    binPhysicsBody.physicsBody?.allowsRotation = false
    binPhysicsBody.physicsBody?.categoryBitMask = CollisionTypes.OtherObject.rawValue
    binPhysicsBody.physicsBody?.collisionBitMask = CollisionTypes.Plane.rawValue
    binPhysicsBody.physicsBody?.contactTestBitMask = CollisionTypes.Plane.rawValue
    binPhysicsBody.physicsBody?.usesPreciseCollisionDetection = false
    binPhysicsBody.physicsBody?.isDynamic = false
    binPhysicsBody.physicsBody?.friction = 1
    binPhysicsBody.physicsBody?.restitution = 0
    binPhysicsBody.physicsBody?.mass = 50
    binPhysicsBody.position = position
    binPhysicsBody.zPosition = 0
    addChild(binPhysicsBody)

}

items.body_markdown:
I have a query regarding restarting my alarms after a phone has been powered back on after a long period of time.

**Normal operation for my alarms**

Currently in my application following the recommendations for API 19 and above I set my alarms on a daily, weekly, monthly and yearly basis by adding days to the calendar and then setExact. After the alarm activates the broadcast receiver will then generate another alarm for the following day or whenever its required using a SQL Lite for reference.

E.g. weekly add 7 days to current alarm (First 21/03/18 - new Alarm 28/03/18)


I also built in the function that if the alarm is in the past then it doesn't activate.

**Scenario**

For example the user originally set weekly alarms starting on the 01/02/18 the phone has now been switched off until lets say 01/08/18 in this time 6 Months have gone past and the SQL Lite hasn't been updated with new alarms dates

Now do I get the background service to build the alarm which would still be in the past then activate and build another but not show a notification until it catches up with the current date e.g. 08/02/18 -> 15/02/18 -> 22/02/18 etc.. until 01/08/18. This to be sounds like the incorrect way of resolving this issue.

Overall I just want to know the best way of restarting my repeating alarms after long periods of time when the device has been turned off.

Thanks
items.title: Android Restarting Alarms after reboot
items.body:
I have a query regarding restarting my alarms after a phone has been powered back on after a long period of time.

Normal operation for my alarms

Currently in my application following the recommendations for API 19 and above I set my alarms on a daily, weekly, monthly and yearly basis by adding days to the calendar and then setExact. After the alarm activates the broadcast receiver will then generate another alarm for the following day or whenever its required using a SQL Lite for reference.

E.g. weekly add 7 days to current alarm (First 21/03/18 - new Alarm 28/03/18)

I also built in the function that if the alarm is in the past then it doesn't activate.

Scenario

For example the user originally set weekly alarms starting on the 01/02/18 the phone has now been switched off until lets say 01/08/18 in this time 6 Months have gone past and the SQL Lite hasn't been updated with new alarms dates

Now do I get the background service to build the alarm which would still be in the past then activate and build another but not show a notification until it catches up with the current date e.g. 08/02/18 -> 15/02/18 -> 22/02/18 etc.. until 01/08/18. This to be sounds like the incorrect way of resolving this issue.

Overall I just want to know the best way of restarting my repeating alarms after long periods of time when the device has been turned off.

Thanks

items.body_markdown:
Recently, I've been conducting a survey. I began creating it in Excel Forms Online but switched to Google Forms after I realized several of its shortcomings. I hit a few snags but I thought I was all set to go.

Unfortunately, I began adding questions to the form and changing responses (misspellings, etc...) and this began causing a whole bunch of problems. It's enough that I have to go back and ask users for their responses to new questions if applicable. What's worse is I can't modify a submission at all. I can't edit the spreadsheet connected to the form because results are stored in the form. If I regenerate the spreadsheet, then the response submitted in the form replaces whatever was there before. So I can't edit the spreadsheet at all.

I've been looking into a way to try to manually edit a user's submitted response. I found a resource [here on Stack Overflow][1], and [here on Google Groups at the Products Forum][2], but unfortunately, I tried all of the examples and none of them worked (yes, I put my form's URL in and everything and replaced the name with the spreadsheet name).

The error I continued receiving after I filled in my info was `TypeError: Cannot call method "getDataRange" of null. (line 8, file "Code")`. But the sheet is not empty and I know that.

Is there some other way to make this work, or a better way to potentially edit sheet responses?

The only way to do this right now is to *manually* go back and re-submit the form again *as that user*. It's kind of a pain because it's 10 minutes of checking boxes and copying and pasting. Plus, last night I accidentally skipped copying 1 character and now I'd have to do it all over again.

From what I've seen online, this can be done, but nothing I have tried works. The form is currently live and accepting responses right now. Any solution is acceptable as long as there would by a way to edit their responses, either with a script or some other tool, so I don't need to manually re-do everything myself.


  [1]: https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10710354/how-to-add-edit-response-link-to-google-forms-emails
  [2]: https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/docs/LSKKCR3VHC8
items.title: How do I edit the response of a form submission in Google Forms/Sheets?
items.body:
Recently, I've been conducting a survey. I began creating it in Excel Forms Online but switched to Google Forms after I realized several of its shortcomings. I hit a few snags but I thought I was all set to go.

Unfortunately, I began adding questions to the form and changing responses (misspellings, etc...) and this began causing a whole bunch of problems. It's enough that I have to go back and ask users for their responses to new questions if applicable. What's worse is I can't modify a submission at all. I can't edit the spreadsheet connected to the form because results are stored in the form. If I regenerate the spreadsheet, then the response submitted in the form replaces whatever was there before. So I can't edit the spreadsheet at all.

I've been looking into a way to try to manually edit a user's submitted response. I found a resource here on Stack Overflow, and here on Google Groups at the Products Forum, but unfortunately, I tried all of the examples and none of them worked (yes, I put my form's URL in and everything and replaced the name with the spreadsheet name).

The error I continued receiving after I filled in my info was TypeError: Cannot call method "getDataRange" of null. (line 8, file "Code"). But the sheet is not empty and I know that.

Is there some other way to make this work, or a better way to potentially edit sheet responses?

The only way to do this right now is to manually go back and re-submit the form again as that user. It's kind of a pain because it's 10 minutes of checking boxes and copying and pasting. Plus, last night I accidentally skipped copying 1 character and now I'd have to do it all over again.

From what I've seen online, this can be done, but nothing I have tried works. The form is currently live and accepting responses right now. Any solution is acceptable as long as there would by a way to edit their responses, either with a script or some other tool, so I don't need to manually re-do everything myself.

items.title: Force https issue in htaccess
items.body:
I am currently dealing with an adsense violation on my site. The issue is the adsense violation specifically deals with a non-SSL url (http). I have a redirect to https in present so no google bots should be picking this up.

Could someone please take a look at what I have in my htaccess and let me know if there is an error in the https force redirect? I feel as though there is a problem in there.

# BEGIN HTTPS Redirection Plugin
<IfModule mod_rewrite.c>
RewriteEngine On
RewriteCond %{SERVER_PORT} !^443$
# WP Fastest Cache compatability
RewriteCond %{REQUEST_URI} !wp-content\/cache\/(all|wpfc-mobile-cache)
RewriteRule ^(.*)$ https://%{HTTP_HOST}%{REQUEST_URI} [L,R=301]
</IfModule>
# END HTTPS Redirection Plugin

# BEGIN WpFastestCache
<IfModule mod_rewrite.c>
RewriteEngine On
RewriteBase /
RewriteCond %{HTTPS} =on
RewriteCond %{HTTP_HOST} ^thepreppingguide.com

**Example Strings:**

> Dandelion The animal dog is blue
> 
> The animal cat is blue 
> 
> Alcohol The animal cow is blue water

I need to use a regex that will capture all instances that starts with the word '**The**' and end with the word '**blue**', but doesn't have the word '**cat**' between these 2 words.

**What I tried:**

`The.*?(?!cat)blue`

**Desired Result:**
>2 Matches:
>
> The animal dog is blue
> 
> The animal cow is blue

Any help would be appreciated greatly
items.title: Regex: Capture Everything between two words that does not have a specific string in the middle
items.body:
Example Strings:

Dandelion The animal dog is blue

The animal cat is blue

Alcohol The animal cow is blue water

I need to use a regex that will capture all instances that starts with the word 'The' and end with the word 'blue', but doesn't have the word 'cat' between these 2 words.

What I tried:

The.*?(?!cat)blue

Desired Result:

2 Matches:

The animal dog is blue

The animal cow is blue

Any help would be appreciated greatly

I don't know have any technical VBA training but by reading forums I am able to piece things together on my own. This one I can't figure out. 

Is it possible to create a loop that copies ranges from one workbook and pastes it to another? I receive cost sheets that contain a variable number of "articles". Each article contains 3 columns of data that I need but they are listed horizontally one after the other. To get to the first article that I need I put the below code. This helps me select the first copy and paste data.

    Cells.Find ("Tot. BOM Cost")
    ActiveCell.Offset(4, 2).Select
    Range(Selection.End(xlDown), Selection.Offset(0, -2)).Select
    Range(Selection, Selection.End(xlDown)).Select
    Selection = sourceRange

From there, I created a loop to highlight the next 3 columns if the cell 2 above and 3 over is not empty. Can I insert any code below so that it will also copy and paste each highlight (each article) in the loop into a different workbook?

    Do
    ActiveCell.Offset(0, 5).Select
    Range(Selection.End(xlDown), Selection.Offset(0, -2)).Select
    ????
    Loop Until IsEmpty(ActiveCell.Offset(-2, 3))

items.body_markdown:
[There is an interesting claim][1] that `MonadIO` constraint tells more about the function using it than if it were using `IO` directly:

    foo :: MonadIO m => m a -> m a

> Reason: MonadIO requires that the IO be in positive, not negative,
> position.
> 
> This lets us know, for example, that foo is safe to use in a
> continuation-based monad like ContT or Conduit.

How does `MonadIO` enforce this? Is it always the case or is it related to the example?

[1]: https://www.yesodweb.com/blog/2016/03/why-i-prefer-typeclass-based-libraries
items.title: Are functions with MonadIO constraint less powerful than ones with IO?
items.body:
There is an interesting claim that MonadIO constraint tells more about the function using it than if it were using IO directly:

foo :: MonadIO m => m a -> m a

Reason: MonadIO requires that the IO be in positive, not negative, position.

This lets us know, for example, that foo is safe to use in a continuation-based monad like ContT or Conduit.

How does MonadIO enforce this? Is it always the case or is it related to the example?

items.title: Angular5 - How to detect empty or deleted field in mat-autocomplete?
items.body:
This is my html which contains the material autocomplete.

<ng-container *ngSwitchCase="'autocomplete'">
    <div [ngClass]="(filter.cssClass || 'col-md-4') + ' mt-2 pt-1'">
        <div class="filter-key-label">
            {{filter.columnTitle}}
        </div>
        <div class="filter-form-control d-flex flex-wrap justify-content-left">
        <mat-form-field class="full-width">
            <input type="text" matInput [formControl]="myControl" [matAutocomplete]="auto" ng-model="blah">
            <mat-autocomplete #auto="matAutocomplete">
                <mat-option *ngFor="let option of getOptionsTypeAhead(filter.key) | async" [value]="option" (onSelectionChange)="typeaheadChange($event, filter.key)">
                {{ option }}
                </mat-option>
            </mat-autocomplete>
            </mat-form-field>
        </div>
    </div>
</ng-container>

Currently I am able to detect only selection changes using onSelectionChange but it so not detects if the field is empty initially or when after having selected an item and then deleting it, I do not select anything and shift focus out of the input field.

How do I detect that?

I tried onkeypress, ng-change coupled with ng-model (was not very sure how to use that) and change but nothing worked. Is there some provision already present by the library or do we detect the change and input field value?

items.title: Need to input multi term polynomial into a linked list instead of single term polynomial
items.body:
This is a duplicate question because I am new to Stack Overflow and I'm not sure what to do with a post when it is put on hold. My old post was put on hold and did not stop being so after I clarified my problem. I re-posted it here because I'm running out of time. The next sentence starts my question. I'm having to do a bonus problem for class in which I allow the user to input a polynomial, read out the polynomials entered, add the polynomials entered, and subtract the polynomials entered. I have gotten my methods to work barely, but my first submission was incorrect because my current program only allows you to enter a single term per polynomial. I need to change it to where the user can input an entire polynomial with multiple terms such as 3x^2 + 2x^1 + 1x^0 instead of just 3x^2.

#include <iostream>

using namespace std;

struct polyInfo
{
    int number;
    int power;
    polyInfo* link;
};

class Polynomial
{
private:
    polyInfo *head;//stores the head of the list
    int maxpow;//stores the maximum power
public:
    Polynomial()  {}
    void createPoly(int n, int p)
    {
        polyInfo *temp = new polyInfo();//creates new node
        temp->power = p;//sets power equal to p
        temp->number = n;//setes number equal to n
        temp->link = head;//sets link to head
        head = temp;//sets head equal to temp
        if (maxpow < p)
        {
            maxpow = p;
        }
    }//end of createPoly

    void getPoly()
    {
        polyInfo *temp = head;//makes a temp pointer equal to head
        while (temp != NULL)//checks if temp is at end of list
        {
            if (temp->number != 0)//makes sure that the number is not 0
            {
                cout << temp->number << "x^" << temp->power << " ";
            }
            temp = temp->link;//sets temp to point to link
        }//end of while
        cout << "\n";
    }//end of getPoly

    void addPoly()
    {
        int numberArray[100];//used to store numbers
        int powerArray[100];//used to store powers
        polyInfo *temp = head;//sets temp pointer to equal head
        int iteration = 0;//used for checking iteration in addition
        int afterLoop = 0;//used for outputting answers afterwards
        while (temp != NULL)
        {
            if (temp->number != 0)
            {
                numberArray[iteration] = temp->number;//inputs number into array
                powerArray[iteration] = temp->power;//inputs power into array

                ++iteration;
                ++afterLoop;
            }
            temp = temp->link;
        }//end of while

        while (iteration > 0)
        {
            for (int addLoop = 0; addLoop < iteration-1; addLoop++)
            {
                if (powerArray[addLoop] == powerArray[iteration-1])
                {
                    //cout << "leet " << numberArray[addLoop] << " + " << numberArray[iteration-1] << "\n";
                    if (!numberArray[addLoop] == 0 && !numberArray[iteration-1] == 0)
                    //checks to make sure that you don't add a zero
                    {
                        numberArray[addLoop] = numberArray[addLoop] + numberArray[iteration-1];
                        //adds the addLoop member and iteration member
                        numberArray[iteration-1] = 0;
                        //and then sets the iteration member to 0 as it has already been added
                        //cout << numberArray[addLoop] << " + " << numberArray[iteration-1] << "\n";
                    }//end of if
                }//end of if
            }//end of for
            --iteration;
         //takes one off of iteration to make sure all polynomials are compared
        }//end of while

        cout << "\nHere are the added polynomials: ";
        while (afterLoop > 0)
        {
            if (!numberArray[afterLoop-1] == 0)
            {
                cout << numberArray[afterLoop-1] << "x^"
                     << powerArray[afterLoop-1];

                if(afterLoop > 1)   cout << " + ";
            }//end of if
            --afterLoop;
        }//end of while

        cout << "\n\n";
    }//end of addPoly method

    void subtractPoly()
    {
        int numberArray[100];
        int powerArray[100];
        polyInfo *temp = head;
        int iteration = 0;
        int afterLoop = 0;
        while (temp != NULL)
        {
            if (temp->number != 0)
            {
                numberArray[iteration] = temp->number;
                powerArray[iteration] = temp->power;

                ++iteration;
                ++afterLoop;
            }//end of if
            temp = temp->link;
        }//end of while

        while (iteration > 0)
        {
            for (int addLoop = 0; addLoop < iteration-1; addLoop++)
            {
                if (powerArray[addLoop] == powerArray[iteration-1])
                {
                    if (!numberArray[addLoop] == 0 && !numberArray[iteration-1] == 0)
                   //checks to make sure that you don't subtract a zero
                    {
                        numberArray[addLoop] = numberArray[addLoop] - numberArray[iteration-1];
                        //subtracts the addLoop member and iteration member
                        numberArray[iteration-1] = 0;
                        //and then sets the iteration member to 0 as it has already been subtracted
                    }//end of if
                }//end of if
             }//end of for
            --iteration;
         //takes one off of iteration to make sure all polynomials are compared
        }//end of while

        cout << "\nHere are the subtracted polynomials: ";
        while (afterLoop > 0)
        {
            if (!numberArray[afterLoop-1] == 0)
            {
                cout << "(" << numberArray[afterLoop-1] << "x^"
                     << powerArray[afterLoop-1] << ")";

                if(afterLoop > 1)   cout << " + ";
            }//end of if
            --afterLoop;
        }//end of while loop
     cout << "\n\n";
    }//end of subtractPoly method
};

int main()
{
    int menuNum;//used to see which menu option user chooses
    int mainPower;//used to store power variable to pass to class
    int mainNumber;//used to store number variable to pass to class

    Polynomial mainPoly;//instantiates object of type Polynomial
    bool menu = true;//not really needed but check for menu

    while (menu)
    {
        cout << "Enter 1 to create new polynomial"
                << "\nEnter 2 to read a polynomial"
                << "\nEnter 3 to add polynomials"
                << "\nEnter 4 to subtract polynomials"
                << "\nEnter 5 to end program :";
        cin >> menuNum;

        switch(menuNum)//does a menu option
        {
            case 1:
                cout << "\nEnter the coefficient: ";
                cin >> mainNumber;
                cout << "\nEnter the exponent of X: ";
                cin >> mainPower;
                mainPoly.createPoly(mainNumber,mainPower);
                //passes the coefficient and power to the class createPoly method
                break;
            case 2:
                mainPoly.getPoly();
                //does the getPoly function of class
                break;
            case 3:
                mainPoly.addPoly();
                //does the addPoly method of the class in order of
                //most recent poly to least recent poly
                break;
            case 4:
                mainPoly.subtractPoly();
                //does the subtractPoly method of the class in order of
                //most recent poly to least recent poly
                break;
            case 5:
                cout << "End of program\n";
                menu = false;
                return 0;
            default:
                cout << "\nInvalid Input, please try again\n\n";
                break;
        }
    }
    return 0;
}
